name: Holiday Inn

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights mid November. The desk staff were VERY helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable.Our room on the 7th floor looked out towards the Dales- great views!
reviews.title: Friendly Staff!

reviews.text: The restaurant was rather expensive- we found the bar snacks and room service was much better value but there are SO many choices of restaurants in Harrogate you are spoilt for choice - all within walking distance of the hotel
reviews.title: A comfortable stay

reviews.text: Overall, a good place to stay!
reviews.title: Love this hotel!!

reviews.text: Stayed on a Saturday night with a friend in a twin room. We were visiting the Turkish baths which is very conveniently located close to the hotel. Parking was £5 in the underground car park. We had a room with a lovely view on the 5th floor overlooking Harrogate. Cleanliness was good, comfy beds. Staff pleasant and helpful. Breakfast very good, plenty of choice. We weren't disturbed by any noise at all overnight.
reviews.title: Clean and tidy but can be pricey

reviews.text: Telephone didn't work in the room so had to walk down to reception to ask something. Could have done with a couple of extra plug points in the room (near the bed would be great for phones overnight) but that is something which I feel most hotels would benefit from in this day and age of multiple gadgets to charge and use.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I was a guest in the hotel for one night when my home become uninhabitable for a night. I was able to book this hotel at the last minute at an ok rate. The room I was given was an odd shape and on the smaller side. The room was mostly clean but some clumps of dust found in the room. The hotel over all is due for a renovation. Check in was ok but slow, check out was painful. One person at the desk who was so so so slow. Very bland on the customer service side of things. I'm sure Harrogate has much better places to stay and the Holiday Inn could do many little things to make this boring hotel better. Good for one night. Look around I would not jump on this hotel unless the rate was around 50 ponds.
reviews.title: Could be better.

reviews.text: Having just spent a fantastic weekend with seventy three friends at a Royal Navy Reunion, I must congratulate the splendid service that we received from the managers and staff at this hotel. To name but a few from Andrew Glover the 'Revenue Manager', Peter, the Operations Manager and not forgetting Claire who was looking after breakfast and Sam on reception. If you want to hold an event in Harrogate do please consider this hotel for it's immaculate rooms and public areas and willing to facilitate every little detail that you would require for your event to go smoothly. The service by the staff at our Gala Night on the Saturday was extremely efficient with the disco supplied by the hotel excellent. The dance floor was never empty considering the age group on average was between 60 and 90! With out a doubt we would use the hotel again when we next have a reunion in Harrogate.
reviews.title: This is the place to hold a reunion of friends.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed here three times and had a great time each visit. The location is just next to the International Centre and also in the centre of Harrogate. The Holiday Inn is quite modern and each time we have stayed there we have been given a super huge bed! The breakfast is lovely too- buffet style but fresh with plenty of choice. I will no doubt be staying here again. The Holiday Inn offer the use of gym facilities which they say are just a few minutes away- it is about a 15 minute walk/ 5 minute drive. The pool etc. was nice but a mini map for visitors to get there easily would be great.
reviews.title: Excellent value and great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were a little small - but otherwise a very comfortable place to stay for one night.
reviews.title: Clean and Tidy
Excellent!
reviews.text: I was lucky to be given executive room for a business stay. I was very happy with everything but the tea bags! Why on earth use Lipton tea when you have Harrogate Tea on your doorstep? My room was clean, comfortable, had a well stocked bathroom and a good view over the town. The staff were polite, friendly and helpful. And at £5 a day, their car park was reasonable. It's only a minute out of the door to find somewhere to eat, but I was happy with their food. For business, it's an excellent hotel.

reviews.title: Could have been better but not entirely their fault
reviews.text: Have stayed here a number of times and its always been adequate. My choice of room is always a double but on this occasion I was allocated a twin, which isn't a problem. The problems started after I returned from dinner to the smell of someone or a number of people smoking in their rooms. The smell was so dense I thought I was on the smoking floor. I entered my room and the smoke followed and continued to come through under the door. It was then when I called Reception and requested a move. Paul on reception advised that this hotel is completely non smoking and would look for a room to move me too while sending up a colleague to investigate. Paul called me back and moved me to an exact room on the 5th floor. His colleague John came and helped me with the move armed with letters reminding guests that it is an offence to smoke in the hotel. I'm not sure what the actual consequences are but I hope it's severe?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well done and thanks to both Paul and John.
reviews.title: Most enjoyable stay in Harrogate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a quick note on the room, finally they have upgraded the TV's. Rooms are clean and have all you need but in This day and age why is there a charge for wifi? The twin beds are not the most comfortable the mattress was a bit lumpy.
reviews.title: Overnight stay

reviews.text: Breakfast has a good choice but I tend to base my breakfast on the sausage, and here it was OK. Service in the breakfast room was also OK.
reviews.title: Great for Conference Centre

reviews.text: had really good time took mam who has to use a walker and was worried about facilities for her, no need to worry all areas very spacious, breakfast and evening meal were included, breakfast was excellent as was dinner only two criticisisms skinny chips served with fish would of been nicer with real chips and the drinks are very pricey otherwise staff friendly and helpful made our stay pleasant have stayed here before but this deal was unbeatable for £149 for 2 people, executive room, breakfast on both mornings and dinner on the 1st evening.
reviews.title: nice stay booked spring deal what a bargain

reviews.text: Had a nice weekend in Harrogate staying in this hotel! Stayed in room 1009 on the top floor- had lovely views of Harrogate:) nice hotel and would stay there again!
reviews.title: Nice location and very clean hotel :)

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights on business. It's a modern, slightly soul-less building next to the conference centre. My employer paid about £120 a night B&B for me to occupy a double room. The underground car park cost £5 a day. The room was clean and quite large with a view of the conference centre (my colleague had a much nicer countryside view from the other side of the corridor). The room was comfortable and the bed OK; the bathroom contained a bath and shower with impressively hot water. The staff were all very nice. Breakfast is buffet-style with everything you'd expect, items were replenished quickly. It got busy around 8am but I think the hotel was full. You probably wouldn't stay here if you were looking for a romantic hotel with cosy features but for the business traveller it was fine.
reviews.title: Business trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located next door to the Conference Centre and is a 10/15 minute walk from the bus, train station and town centre. The rooms are spacious and adequate. The breakfast buffet was very good with a wide range of cooked items. The reception staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: GREAT LOCATION
Great location especially if at a conference next door.
reviews.text: There is a pleasant bar area and plenty of seating in the reception/foyer area.

Stayed at this hotel for a 2 night week-end break with a female friend.Having purchased this offer on Groupon we were slighlty apprehensive.The offer was for a double room but we had requested a twin which was what we got. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful.As we checked in we asked about the evening meal only to be told the restaurant was fully booked that evening.My friend had rung during the day to check our booking and to ask what time dinner was served till as we wouldn't be arriving until early evening.She was not told at this point that you have to make a reservation,for which the reception staff were very apologetic.We ventured out into Harrogate in search of Pizza Express after getting a map and directions from reception! The town is easily walkable from the hotel.Having slept well on comfy beds we went for breakfast. Yes, this was busy but we were shown to a table quickly and enjoyed the variety of hot and cold food on the buffet.After a full morning shopping we went back for our coffee and cake which was included in the offer. The cake was a small piece of fruit cake, but a choice of coffee was appreciated.Evening meal was very pleasant, having everything explained to us from the helpful waitress about our deal we enjoyed a 2 course meal with with a bottle of wine.The only problem we encountered all week-end was the wait for lifts on Sunday morning as everyone was checking out. We had tried to locate the stairs at one point, but they didn't seem to go anywhere! Overall cleanliness was okay, not exceptional.The bath and toilet were a little dated and having sat on the toilet seat to get dried I discovered the seat was very cheap plastic as it sunk under my weight!! But a good week end was enjoyed. On leaving we were dreading the car park fees, but were pleasantly surprised at how reasonable they were.I would recommend this hotel and especially its location. Thank you Groupon for this bargain week end.
reviews.title: Enjoyable week-end

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated next to the conference centre makes this a good place to stay. Comfortable rooms, good self service breakfast, and a good evening meal with excellent service made a very it a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Stayed at the Holliday Inn for a weekend , the rooms were good and the staff were great,the weekend break included a meal in the hotel restaurant this was also very good,and the head waiter couldnt do enough for us.We would definitely recommend this hotel,for a short break.
reviews.title: visit to Harrogate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a two night break through Groupon which included dinner on the first night and afternoon cakes and tea. The first thing that went wrong was that we were allocated a twin room instead of a double room. We had to have a adapted room as that was the only one left.
reviews.title: Large busy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner was pleasant, but we had to pay extra as we had a set allowance for the meal which Groupon did not explain when we booked through them.
reviews.title: I would never stay here again!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The holiday inn at Harrogate is typical of the brand and did not disappoint. Check was speedy and the staff extremely courteous. The room on floor 9 was in the Executive section, lifts were always available and enclosed off from the rooms in a small lobby on this floor; we did not hear any noise at all. The room was typical of the brand, with table and chairs a large bed, tea and coffee making facilities, trouser press and large wardrobe with safe. The bathroom had good lighting and I was impressed with the make-up mirror which lit up. The toiletries and amenity kit was very welcome and better than the usual wall-hung soap dispenser so many hotels seem to be adopting. The room had a nice window and the view overlooked the rolling hills and out to the countryside - this would have been wonderful if the weather had been better. The window also opened, which was a bonus. The only niggle was the old model tv and the picture quality was poor.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay at the HI Harrogate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room during the night was nice and quiet and we didn't hear and noise from neighbours, traffic etc.
reviews.title: Good value hotel. The staff increase its rating

reviews.text: As the weather was dire, we had a meal in the bar and this was fine, certainly not upscale, but good value for the money. The bar staff were very pleasant and when not serving kept busy tidying the bar and seating areas.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We did not have breakfast, but were advised that if you booked with Reception, the price would be reduced if you booked ahead.
reviews.title: GOOD VALUE for CHEAP HOLIDAY BASE

reviews.text: Overall a pleasant stay. This HI is pretty much charmless and ordinary and if you are looking for somewhere quaint and homely in Harrogate you might be better off with a B&B. Having said that, the service and staff were great and I feel that as a business traveller, you could not go wrong here.
reviews.title: Excellent staff, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was a part of a trip to Harrogate to visit the Harlow Carr Gardens and the Spring Flower Show. It was the first time we had visited Harrogate and were impressed not only with the gardens, but also with this hotel. It was very convenient for the town centre. For any hotel to cater for so many guests to such a standard is a testament to them. We felt at home from the moment we stepped through the door. All the staff were welcoming and very efficient without seeming to be hurrying you. The room was comfortable, quiet and clean and the food.....well, it was the first time that a carvery was not guilty of overcooked veg and soggy carrots! The breakfast buffet was all that could be desired. The catering staff were very amenable and we saw no evidence of grumpiness. Well done Holiday Inn and well done Harrogate.
reviews.title: Well Done Harrogate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We looked forward to this meal expecting to be proudly served a local speciality. However inedible roast beef and yorkshire pudding, served by a grumpy 'chef' on cold plates, on Sunday night let down the hotel. 'Chef' not interested when advised that plates were cold and appeared irritated when he had to go to kitchen for more yorkshire pudding - he need not have bothered as it was awful. Mass produced buffet style breakfasts and meals on the other three nights were just adequate. Other staff in hotel were helpful and pleasant. Room and hotel clean but overpriced.
reviews.title: Poor Roast Beef and Yorkshire Pudding in YORKSHIRE !

reviews.text: stayed for one night only and cant fault the room or the breakfast, but the smell in the hallways of the hotel were stinking!! dirty drain smell not good at all. However the rooms were ok once you were in and shut the door
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: Stayed for an exhibition over 2 nights the rooms were the usual high standard of cleanliness with a good choice of buffet breakfast. The hotel is centrally located and close to the exhibition hall, however my complaint was that due to there being an exhibition we had to pay much more than the average room rate, which I thought was very disappointing.
reviews.title: Usual high standards

reviews.text: Stayed here over Easter as part of a coach holiday. From the start the service was very good and efficiant. We had a twin room of the 5th floor overlooking the countryside. It was very clean with good wardrobe space. The bathroom was very bright with absolutly huge bath towels. Full marks for that. The service in the restaurant was very good as was the selection of meals. Though with breakfast the food seemed to get cold fairly quickly. The room was nice and quiet. But the tv was in desperate need of an update shown up by the tv in the bar. The barman was very good even apologizing when we mentioned that that coffee was very strong. Which could have been more to do with our taste in coffee than how stong they made it. The hotel is very central to the town and conference centre.
reviews.title: Good service

reviews.text: We recently stayed for the second time this year at the HI. The staff were courteous and polite and check-in very speedy. The room was very pleasant on the 11th floor. It was a bitterly cold day and night when we arrived, but the room was very warm. The bed was comfortable and the level of cleanliness excellent. The rooms were quiet with no noise from neighbours.
reviews.title: Another good stay

reviews.text: The bar staff were especially friendly and helpful; the hot chocolate excellent.
reviews.title: Ok Stay for business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was an additional £10.00 and this included a varied choice of hot and cold offerings, which were all good.
reviews.title: dentist and Bettys

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we could not fault the Holiday Inn and would certainly return and recommend this very nice hotel.
reviews.title: 2 day break in Harrogate

reviews.text: Checked in on Tuesday afternoon for three nights. No line so dealt with quickly and given an exec room as booked. Offered an alarm call and paper (although as Platinum Priority club this should have been as standard) but didnt know when I needed to wake up having checked in at 4pm.
reviews.title: Not luxury but functional and convenient

description: Holiday Inn Harrogate is a 4-star hotel, ideally located in the town centre adjoining the Harrogate International Conference Centre. This 214 bedroom hotel is only 8 miles from the A1(M).Many rooms have stunning views across both the famous Yorkshire Spa town and the surrounding countryside. Both contemporary and welcoming, the fantastic Classics bar and Restaurant 701 offers a wide variety of traditional and International dishes from around the world. All guests can benefit from our association with The Academy nearby, Harrogates premier health and fitness Club providing complimentary use of the indoor heated swimming pool, gym, sauna and steam room. The club is conveniently located less than a mile from the hotel. Our flexible range of conference and meeting rooms provide excellent facilities for up to 360 delegates with extensive break-out facilities, all air-conditioned for your comfort. Our meeting rooms feature the very latest conference equipment and high-speed Internet access.Holiday Inn Harrogate is the ideal base to explore the delights of the Yorkshire Countryside including Bolton Abbey, Ripon Cathedral, Harewood House, Richmond Castle, Fountains Abbey and the Lightwater Valley Theme Park. In accordance with English law this hotel is now non-smoking throughout.
